docs.lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority officially resolved a dispute with its largest transit union, but its conflict with Long Island Rail Road workers appeared as intractable as ever.

headline.main: One Step Forward, One Back for M.T.A. on Union Contracts
headline.print_headline: One Step Forward, One Back for M.T.A. on Union Deals

docs.abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority approves contract with Transport Workers Union Local 100, officially ending long-running dispute with its largest transit union, but conflict with employees of Long Island Rail Road appears as intractable as ever; MTA officials are grappling with decision of federal mediation panel to reject authority's contract proposal for LIRR workers.
docs.snippet: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority officially resolved a dispute with its largest transit union, but its conflict with Long Island Rail Road workers appeared as intractable as ever.

docs.lead_paragraph: Grand jury subpoenas demanded all records, including email correspondence and memos related to federal funds that might have been used in developing, building or administering the state’s website.

headline.main: Prosecutors Investigating Grants for Health Site in Oregon
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors Trail Grants Used for Site in Oregon

docs.abstract: Gov John Kitzhaber of Oregon releases grand jury subpoenas demanding all records related to the application or receipt of federal funds that might have been used in developing, building or administering the state's health care exchange website; Oregon had received $305 million in federal grants to build its exchange, but flaws were so profound that state became the first to abandon its self-administered system in favor of federal exchange.
docs.snippet: Grand jury subpoenas demanded all records, including email correspondence and memos related to federal funds that might have been used in developing, building or administering the state’s website.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The allegations that hospitals falsified data to hide long wait times for veterans are disgraceful. If true, President Obama has to punish those responsible.
docs.abstract: Editorial demands that Pres Obama follow through on his 2008 vow to improve veterans' health care system and address backlogs; calls for decisive government action in wake of allegations of wrongdoing by Department of Veterans Affairs, such as manipulation of data to hide long delays; calls such treatment of veterans disgraceful, and holds Pres Obama's reputation rests on his ability to right situation.
docs.snippet: The allegations that hospitals falsified data to hide long wait times for veterans are disgraceful. If true, President Obama has to punish those responsible.

docs.lead_paragraph: Instacart matches independent contractors who are good at grocery shopping with customers too busy to shop for themselves.
docs.abstract: Farhad Manjoo State of the Art column examines Instacart, two-year-old grocery delivery start-up that matches independent contractors good at grocery shopping with customers too busy to shop for themselves; notes service differs from other grocery delivery services in a way that could redefine the future of labor; says company's success suggests that technology might create new labor opportunities for people who have not acquired formal credentials or skills.
docs.snippet: Instacart matches independent contractors who are good at grocery shopping with customers too busy to shop for themselves.
